properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 29 at 9:08PM AKST until March 1 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Visibility will drop to one
quarter mile or less. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches.
Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts as high as 60 mph.

* WHERE...Along the coast from Dillingham to Pilot Point.

* WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM AKST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are most likely around
King Salmon in the morning.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay
with your vehicle.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM AKST SUNDAY ALONG THE COAST FROM DILLINGHAM TO PILOT POINT
